net.cloud.server.event.command.commands

Class AbstractCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.event.command.commands.AbstractCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CmdScriptCommand, CreateAccountCommand, EchoCommand, LoadActionCommand, NoParameterCommand, TestCommand

    public abstract class AbstractCommand
extends Object
implements Command
    An AbstractCommand implements the Command interface, and imposes some new methods. Most importantly, an AbstractCommand has code to handle parsing the parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllOptionalParameters

        protected abstract OptionalParameter<?>[] getAllOptionalParameters()
        Returns:
        An array with all of the optional parameters the command can possibly accept

      • getAllRequiredParameters

        protected abstract RequiredParameter<?>[] getAllRequiredParameters()
        Returns:
        An array with all of the parameters the command must have

      • parseArguments

        public void parseArguments(String argumentLine)
                    throws CommandException
        Takes a string containing the arguments provided to the command, and parses it into individual parameters - where are added to the lists.
        Specified by:
        parseArguments in interface Command
        Parameters:
        argumentLine - The parameters passed to the command
        Throws:
        CommandException - If for some reason parsing is unsuccessful - it will have a useful message

      • parseOptParam

        private void parseOptParam(StringBuilder argBuilder)
                    throws CommandException
        Take care of parsing an optional parameter. When done, it is added to the list.
        Parameters:
        argBuilder - The StringBuilder with the remaining parameter line
        Throws:
        CommandException - If the parameter could not be parsed

      • findProtoOptParam

        private OptionalParameter<?> findProtoOptParam(boolean longForm,
                                               String paramName)
                                        throws CommandException
        Determine which of the optional parameters - if any - match the one provided. Simple finds and returns the prototype parameter, does not attempt parsing
        Parameters:
        longForm - True if the name is the long name
        paramName - The name of the optional parameter
        Returns:
        The prototype parameter. Will never be null
        Throws:
        CommandException - If the parameter could not be found

      • parseReqParam

        private void parseReqParam(StringBuilder argBuilder,
                           int reqParamIdx)
                    throws CommandException
        Take care of parsing a required parameter. When done, it is added to the list.
        Parameters:
        argBuilder - The StringBuilder with the remaining parameter line
        reqParamIdx - The index of the RequiredParameter we're currently looking at
        Throws:
        CommandException - If the parameter could not be parsed

      • getProvidedOptionalParameters

        public Iterator<OptionalParameter<?>> getProvidedOptionalParameters()
        Returns:
        The optional parameters *actually* given to the command after parsing

      • getOptParam

        public <T> Optional<OptionalParameter<T>> getOptParam(String name)
        Obtain an OptionalParameter by name. If the parameter has been provided, the returned Optional will contain the parameter. If it has not been, the returned Optional will be empty. It can be checked for the presence of a value, to safely decide on an action. Optional-ception!
        Usage note: Prefer storing the optional. Each call of this method will search again and create a new Optional.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value within the parameter
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the parameter. Short or long form. Case sensitive.
        Returns:
        An Optional wrapping the parameter if present, or an empty optional if not.

      • hasOptParam

        public boolean hasOptParam(String name)
        Check to see if an optional parameter has been provided. This will check via getOptParam(name).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the parameter. Short or long form. Case sensitive.
        Returns:
        True if the parameter with the given name has been provided

      • provideOptionalParameter

        public void provideOptionalParameter(OptionalParameter<?> parameter)
        Tell this command that the optional parameter is being passed to it
        Parameters:
        parameter - The parameter to provide to the command

      • getProvidedRequiredParameters

        public Iterator<RequiredParameter<?>> getProvidedRequiredParameters()
        Returns:
        The required parameters *actually* given to the command after parsing

      • getReqParam

        public <T> RequiredParameter<T> getReqParam(int index)
                                     throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Short convenience method to get a required parameter. The returned value is cast to an inferred type. This must be the correct type, and it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure this.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value within the parameter
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the parameter. Store in declared order.
        Returns:
        The RequiredParameter at the given index
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of bounds

      • provideRequiredParameter

        public void provideRequiredParameter(RequiredParameter<?> parameter)
        Tell this command that the required parameter is being passed to it
        Parameters:
        parameter - The parameter to provide to the command
